alert.note: Alert for Pittsburg (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 02 at 10:51PM CDT until May 02 at 11:45PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM CDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Oklahoma, including the following county, Pittsburg. * WHEN...Until 100 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1051 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mcalester... Krebs... Kiowa... Savanna... Alderson... Ashland... Mcalester Regional Airport... Haywood... Blanco... Haileyville... Pittsburg... Arpelar... Bache... Dow... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
